A **Uruk-hai shield** is a type of [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") and appears as a **white-handed shield** when unidentified.

The [orcish shield](/wiki/Orcish_shield "Orcish shield") is a near-identical shield with a different appearance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

[Orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters start the game with knowledge of the Uruk-hai shield.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai") have a 1⁄3 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an Uruk-hai shield;[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Uruk-hai armor, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with Uruk-hai shields.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Description

While worn, an Uruk-hai shield grants 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Shield#Strategy](/wiki/Shield#Strategy "Shield")*

Like orcish shields, Uruk-hai shields are fairly heavy and provide no more AC than a [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") while significantly inhibiting [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") - they may suffice to fill out the shield slot momentarily, but should ideally be replaced with a lighter or better shield as soon as possible.

The Uruk-hai shield is mainly useful as [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") for [racial conducts](/wiki/Unofficial_conduct#Racial "Unofficial conduct") involving orcs.

## History

The Uruk-hai shield first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Uruk-hai](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruk-hai "wikipedia:Uruk-hai")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Saruman](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saruman "wikipedia:Saruman")***

The basis for the Uruk-hai of *NetHack* are the orcs that served under the wizard Saruman in [J. R. R. Tolkien](/wiki/J._R._R._Tolkien "J. R. R. Tolkien")'s world of Middle-earth, particularly the company that guarded the tower of Isengard. The shields of these Uruks bore a small White Hand of Saruman centered on a black field, as opposed to the red-eyed shields of Sauron's armies: Saruman's white hand symbol was a deliberate imitation of the red eye used by Sauron. In *NetHack*, this is reflected in the shield's unidentified appearance and default [tile](/wiki/Tileset "Tileset").

## Variants

Some variants distinguish the orcish and Uruk-hai shields, and others may give [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") (including orcish characters) an AC bonus for wearing Uruk-hai shields.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), Uruk-hai shields can be [upgraded](/wiki/Upgraded "Upgraded") into [elven shields](/wiki/Elven_shield "Elven shield"), and upgrading an elven shield will produce either an orcish shield or an Uruk-hai shield, with an equal chance of each item.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), Uruk-hai shields grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), Uruk-hai shields grant 2 base AC, 0 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")1 while worn. Like all shields, they add their full enchantment to AC while giving no bonus to DR.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Uruk-hai shields count as bulky for purposes of spellcasting penalties, while orcish shields do not.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Uruk-hai shields grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

An Uruk-hai shield can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining two orcish shields.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), Uruk-hai shields grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 862](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L862)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 412](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L412): *armor and weapons for Uruk-Hai*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 400](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L400): *switch for orc-captains*
